features: [9 Preset Modes] Features a clear-view LCD screen, Stop with the guesswork and don’t burn your clothes; Select your fabric type and always iron with the right heat; Ideal temps for nylon, silk, wool, cotton, jeans, linen and more

[Double Ceramic Soleplate] Harder than stainless steel, super scratch resistant, and more durable and easier to clean; Protect your delicate clothes with a unique double-layer design that ensures even heating of the entire soleplate

Be Safer with Auto Shutoff: We all get distracted at some point, so don’t put those around you at risk; Motion sensors automatically shut off the iron to avoid danger when it sits motionless for too long; Shuts off after 30 seconds when laying flat and 8 minutes when vertical

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Digital LCD Display The integrated display and 9 presets make precise temperatures setting for all kinds of fabrics, including acrylic, nylon, silk, poly, blend, wool, cotton, jeans, and linen, extremely easy. Ultimate Gliding Performance Ceramic coated soleplate delivers ultimate gliding performance over any fabric. Non-stick, scratch-resistant and easy to keep clean. Most Powerful 1800Watt Heats up quickly, 40% more steam, easily blast away for stubborn wrinkles or creases, effortless ironing every time.

Safety 3-Way Auto Shut-Off Motion-sensitive technology shuts off the iron automatically after 8 minutes if left vertical and after 30 seconds if left horizontal or when tipped over. Self-Cleaning System Easily keep your iron in optimal condition using the self-cleaning function to clean the internal soleplate and flush out loose mineral deposits, ensuring clean, long-lasting steaming. Anti-Calcium System Automatically filters water in the tank to prevent calcium build-up and both maintain peak performance and increase the lifetime of the iron. Prevents Leaks and Spills Prevents water leaks when the iron is at a low temperature so there's no need to worry about stain-causing water droplets falling on clothes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Don't look any further.
reviews.reviewText: I am so impressed with this iron. I am old and old fashioned and have been looking for an iron that could do the job that my 1970's model did for years. This iron had good simple and helpful features, a large sole plate with a LOT of steam holes so it really blasts the garment good. (My husband has awful mystery fabric FR work shirts that resist all pressing techniques.) This iron really made them look nice. It has weight to it and feels good in the hand. The weight gives more balance so it stays put when set down. Hope I never have to buy another. The price was good too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really nice quality
reviews.reviewText: Has nice weight, multi function settings, digital display. Works great. Makes ironing a breeze.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent iron at a GREAT price!!
reviews.reviewText: I had my Rowenta for about 15 years and loved it until it started smelling like an electrical fire. I cried when I unplugged it as it had done such a great job for me for so long.Yeah it’s been 15 years since I looked at irons but WHOOOAA NELLIE dayum they got pricey too!!! SHEESH!!! $120 for an iron?!?! Gasp! Oh how I missed my Rowenta! So I did a little research and this new name Beautral kept coming up. Then I looked at the reviews here and they were very good! The iron had all the features I needed which was basically steam, a cord, and a good price!When I got it though I was truly VERY pleasantly surprised!!! It’s a very lightweight iron, but the ceramic plate irons like it’s made of true iron! You don’t want to put much pressure on this guy—it will give you a warning if you do—as you don’t need to! Just a little time, a few swipes and it’s wrinkle free!The water tank on this iron is HUGE! If you iron a lot of cottons like I do then you’ll love this! The only drag is that the refill jar included is very small, and the refill hole is also very small. With practice it’s easy now.I haven’t tried using this with vertical steam, but I sure would like to as the steam that comes out of this iron is amazing! It’s hands-down a big upgrade over my old Rowenta! Plus I think I paid less for it than I did for the Rowenta 15 years ago.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Best Iron I Ever Had Until Today
reviews.reviewText: After almost 4 years to the day of what was probably the best iron I ever purchased (no leaks, fast heating, smooth sole plate) it finally happened . . . the dreaded error 2. The Iron displayed error 2, beeped and would no longer heat. So having read there is no way to fix the iron when this issue occurs, the iron went in the garbage but I did purchase the exact same model again. Hopefully this one will have a longer life. It was good while it lasted.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally a quality iron
reviews.reviewText: Sturdy, well made, easy controls, and smart on/off. All at a good cost. Easy self clean instructions. Good buy

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This quilter/crafter is impressed!
reviews.reviewText: Every so often, I need a new iron because my "old faithful" is too tired to tackle tough wrinkles or make crisp creases when folding multiple layers of fabric. It's sad, but it happens. I have always chosen name-brand irons (Hamilton Beach, Oliso), but this time I felt adventurous.This Beautural iron surprised and delighted me. It heats up super fast and is generous with steam at all the appropriate settings. The automatic shut-off is long enough to allow me to fuss and fiddle as much as necessary and still go back to a hot iron, but not long enough to be a danger to me or my electric bill. The little screen telling you the setting is easy to read, and the beep notifying you that it's ready or that it's shutting off is one of the more polite-sounding alerts I've heard. It has a nice like cord (like most irons) and a very generous water tank.My only complaint (and it's small) is the heat and steam controls. I'm used to dials or knobs; I find them easier to manipulate for my 65-year-old hands. This iron has a button on the left to increase the heat and a button on the right to decrease the heat. In the middle is a clear plastic slide for the steam. Call me crazy, but the mechanism feels flimsy and looks as if it's destined to break first.Overall, I love my new purchase. If you're in the market for a new iron, seriously consider this one—especially if you don't mind pushing buttons!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great iron at a great price
reviews.reviewText: Easy to fill with water, great variety of temperature controls. Long cord, not too heavy or too light in weight. Produces a nice amount of steam. Would purchase again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heats up fast
reviews.reviewText: I plugged it in and set the temperature and it heated up in less than 1 minute. Very fast. The weight is perfect for ironing clothes. It irons smoothly with the coated sole plate which is nice and it doesn't stick. The controls are user friendly so you can use them with your thumb onto the handle. The LCD screen tells you what type of fabric you are setting the tem for. Very nice. The handle is a little big with bumps on it for gripping. This doesn't bother me. The buttons for the steam burst and spray are easy to use and work nicely. The adjustment for the steam is between the steam burst and spray buttons and can be adjusted with you thumb as needed. The filling hole for the water is a little small but that's not an issue. I am very satisfied with this product.

For years and years I have used Rowenta irons - expensive, but believed them to be a good product so worth it. However, after having several Rowenta's through the years that always start leaking, and just not working well I finally thought time for a change! I searched for reviews on irons and as this one kept coming up with good reviews - I decided to take a chance on a (to me) no-name iron and I am so glad I did!! Now having used this iron for the last 4 months - I just love it. It has good water capacity, easy to use controls, good safety features and it just plain does what it is meant to do and far better than any Rowenta I have ever had. Love it! Amazing for the price.
Recibí mi producto, llegó muy bien y funciona de maravilla, la calidad me parece excelente, estoy muy satisfecha con esta compra, definitivamente lo volvería a adquirir.

With the passing of our old iron, we were at the situation where we needed to get something new or not have pressed clothes. We decided that indeed, buying a new iron was the way to go. And we decided to go with this one. Why?!. Yes this iron may be more expensive than others but honestly so far it's worked like a dream. The steam function is great. It uses a lot of water and it's easy to use.2. It's lightweight and easy to store.3. It's not awful to look at as far as irons go!Really appreciate this iron. Very nice product. I haven't had issues with it breaking and I've been using it for a couple of months now. No stuck on issues. Overall, just a great iron.
Had the iron a year and a half heats up quick great steam function. No issues and great price
This iron is a beast...but in a good way! Heats up super fast, has 8 settings, great steamer and easy to use. It's a little on the heavy side but overall great purchase!
